subject: p18067737
History: -year-old male with chest burning, to rule out worsening effusion.
Findings: In comparison to the prior study, there has been no significant interval change in the left hilar mass with volume loss and opacification in left upper lobe, which likely represents postobstructive pneumonia/collapse. The right lung is clear. No large pleural effusion or pneumothorax is seen.
Impression: No significant interval change since the prior study in the extensive left upper lobe consolidation and hilar mass. No large pleural effusions.
